Records.Name: DocumentDateTime
Records.Description: Date and time when the document is created. Format must be yyyymmddhhmm / 201910111059

Records.Name: SenderId
Records.Description: Identifier for the sender.Finnish customers should use Sender ID (FI: OVT-tunnus), which is based on company business id. Foreign customers must always agree with Posti which Sender ID is used.

Records.Name: ReceiverId
Records.Description: Identifier for the receiver. See separate Posti code list.

Records.Name: ?xml
Records.Description: Root element of the message with namespace.

Records.Name: version
Records.Description: Root element of the message with namespace.

Records.Name: encoding
Records.Description: Root element of the message with namespace.

Records.Name: Postra
Records.Description: Root element of the message with namespace.

Records.Name: xmlns
Records.Description: Root element of the message with namespace.

Records.Name: SenderId
Records.Description: Identifier for the sender.Finnish customers should use Sender ID (FI: OVT-tunnus), which is based on company business id. Foreign customers must always agree with Posti which Sender ID is used.

Records.Name: ReceiverId
Records.Description: Identifier for the receiver. See separate Posti code list.

Records.Name: DocumentDateTime
Records.Description: Date and time when the document is created. Format must be ISO 8601, e.g. 2019-10-11T10:00:00+03:00

Records.Name: Sequence
Records.Description: Unique identifier for the message. Used in message error handling, preferred to use message counter or other technical unique value (GUID), or datetime with milliseconds. Shipment waybill number should NOT be used.

Records.Name: MessageVersion
Records.Description: Allowed values: 1. When message version is upgraded, the previous versions are not compatible with new version. Version upgrade always requires also changes at customer side

Records.Name: MessageRelease
Records.Description: Allowed values: 2. Different releases within same MessageVersion are compatible with each other. New release doesn’t necessarily require changes at customer side.

Records.Name: TestIndicator
Records.Description: Allowed value: true. Not used in production messages.Mandatory to use "true" when the message is a test message.

Records.Name: MessageFunctionCode
Records.Description: Allowed values: ORIGINAL. Message can be received only once. Posti cannot handle update or cancellation by messages for shipment data. Contact Posti customer service when needed. (CANCEL and REPLACE are not currently in usage)

Records.Name: ShipmentNumber
Records.Description: Shipment/waybill identifier (like “rahtikirjan numero” or packing list number). This identifies the shipment, which contains one or more packages to the same recipient within one day.

Records.Name: ShipmentDateTime
Records.Description: Shipment date/time, e.g. when shipment is ready for transport. Format must be ISO 8601, e.g. 2019-10-11T10:00:00+03:00

Records.Name: Totals
Records.Description: Total value for weight and quantity of shipment. See allowed decimals for each type below.

Records.Name: Total
Records.Description: Total value for weight and quantity of shipment. See allowed decimals for each type below.

Records.Name: type
Records.Description: WEIGHT Use 2 decimals. Always in kilograms. PACKAGE_QUANTITY No decimals allowed.

Records.Name: DeliveryDate
Records.Description: Date when Posti is requested to deliver the goods. Date is only suggestive; delivery is performed according to Posti transport terms and conditions. Field is mandatory with certain additional services; see separate Posti codelist for more instructions. Format must be ISO 8601, e.g. 2019-09-17.

Records.Name: timeEarliest
Records.Description: Desired earliest time when goods can be delivered. Format must be ISO 8601, e.g. 10:00:00+03:00.

Records.Name: timeLatest
Records.Description: Desired latest time when goods can be delivered. Format must be ISO 8601, e.g. 16:00:00+03:00.

Records.Name: AgreedDeliveryDate
Records.Description: Date when Posti is requested to deliver the goods. Date is only suggestive; delivery is performed according to Posti transport terms and conditions. Field is mandatory with certain additional services; see separate Posti codelist for more instructions. Format must be ISO 8601, e.g. 2019-09-17.

Records.Name: Instruction
Records.Description: Informational text concerning transportation (“Lisätiedot” printed on address label). Note that only additional service codes ensure service fulfilment.

Records.Name: typeCode
Records.Description: Allowed values: CONSIGNOR - Printed on invoice report. INVOICE_NUMBER - Used only with international transports. TRANSPORT_UNIT - Used only with Posti's 22-digit transport unit ID. IOSS_NUMBER - Import One-Stop Shop (IOSS) is used for declaration and payment of VAT for distance sales of imported good.

Records.Name: currencyCode
Records.Description: Currency code in ISO 4217 format. Only EUR is allowed.

Records.Name: CodBIC
Records.Description: Cash on delivery, BIC (Bank Identifier Code) of the named bank (also known as SWIFT code).

Records.Name: CodIBAN
Records.Description: Cash on delivery, bank account in IBAN format

Records.Name: CodValue
Records.Description: Cash on delivery value. Use 2 decimals.

Records.Name: currencyCode
Records.Description: Currency code in ISO 4217 format. Only EUR is allowed.

Records.Name: Account
Records.Description: Consignor contract number for Posti parcel service.

Records.Name: Name1
Records.Description: Company name. In case Consignor is private person, use first name and last name.

Records.Name: Country
Records.Description: Country code in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

Records.Name: languageCode
Records.Description: Language code for arrival notes in Finland, allowed values: fi = Finnish, sv = Swedish, en = English

Records.Name: ContactChannel
Records.Description: Mobile phone number preferred be in the international format, e.g. +358 XX XXX XXXX.

Records.Name: PackageQuantity
Records.Description: Number of packages. Default is 1. See more details for MPS cases in this document on page 4.

Records.Name: type
Records.Description: Package description code. See separate Posti code list for allowed values.

Records.Name: GrossWeight
Records.Description: Gross weight in kilograms. Use 3 decimals.

Records.Name: GoodsNature
Records.Description: Nature of goods. Used only with international postal services. See separate Posti code list for allowed values.

Records.Name: ReturnCode
Records.Description: Return code in case of non-delivery. Only used with international postal services. See separate Posti code list for allowed values

Records.Name: LimitedQuantityWeight
Records.Description: Used when dangerous goods are packed in limited quantities and full DG details are not required by ADR regulations. Sum all LQ packed DG gross weights included to one GoodsItem (e.g. one colli, or pallet) and inform the total LQ gross weight here. Amount is always gross weight in kg. Mandatory when applicable. Use 3 decimals.

Records.Name: RoutingCode
Records.Description: Routing code, e.g. 2LSE79172+70000000. Mandatory with certain service codes, e.g. Parcel Connect.

Records.Name: Product
Records.Description: Product code. See separate Posti product matrix.

Records.Name: Service
Records.Description: Additional service code. See separate Posti product matrix

Records.Name: TrackingNumber
Records.Description: Package/colli ID which is printed on package label as barcode. Can be Posti's JJFI code, UPU/S10 or SSCC.
